programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod realise they will have to pool their resources with Barry if they are to stand any chance of making a profit at an auction in San Jacinto.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones head to Chinatown, where a group of local thugs attempts to scupper the plucky duo's plans.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones run into an old friend and former employee at a particularly lively auction, and her new-found confidence seems set to lead to a confrontation.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Jenny makes a series of extravagant bids to come out on top at an auction in Longview.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Veteran locker bidder Puffy - who also happens to be Ricky's mother - causes a commotion when she competes in a storage battle in upscale Haslet.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz are delighted when they visit a house packed with rare collectibles - but are less pleased by the prices the owner is asking for them.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The swampers venture out in a storm, but while one team uses the weather to its advantage, another hunter suffers a tragic accident.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Members of the Coquihalla Highway rescue crew face their toughest recovery as they are forced to pull a damaged truck up a sheer 400-metre cliff.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers value renowned photographer Ansel Adams' lost work, and hope to acquire a Jaguar XJ6 and a ball signed by the 1946 Chicago Bears team.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Staff at the Las Vegas pawn shop get the chance to buy a 450-year-old book allegedly annotated by Isaac Newton, a Spanish-American War jacket and John Wayne memorabilia.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The price of gold begins to fall, and the staff worry that they could end up losing money. Les, Seth and Ashley become more conscious of what items they buy.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les offers to buy a diamond-encrusted watch from a customer. He makes sure his jewellery expert takes a close look, having been stung by a similar deal previously.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Zachary Quinto explores the terrifying concept of mind control, meeting an alleged victim implanted with an electronic harassment device in his head.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: For the Benefit of Mr Charles
programme.desc: Mary brings a mysterious friend to an auction, and Jenny adopts a bold new strategy.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The auction season ends with a record-breaking sale, and Moe chooses the one purchase his wife allows him to make each year.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The price of gold continues to drop. Seth suggests they should review their purchases, and sort out the cluttered sales floor, along with a warehouse overloaded with junk.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth is angered when Les dismisses the consultant's suggestions about improving business practices. Seth disappears, and his manager fears he may be on the verge of quitting.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers examine some vintage artwork from a Spider-Man comic-book, a piece of the Apollo 13 rocket, and a classic motorcycle.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers get the chance to buy a re-creation of the Batmobile from Tim Burton's Batman movies, a spy's desk, and a letter signed by Thomas Jefferson and James Madison.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi try to get the better of some inexperienced new faces on the auction circuit, while Barry attends a sale in Inglewood.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Orange You Glad Dan Sold It Again?
programme.desc: At an auction in Burbank, California, a new buyer challenges both Barry and Jarrod - and ends up buying a locker that is packed full of surprises.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Auction Hunters Ton and Allen get into a bidding war with two highly competitive women over a heavy Gatling gun and an old suit of armour.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: In Philadelphia, Allen Haff and Ton Jones tackle former NFL player Vince Papale over a vintage football-passing machine and a colonial musket.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor sets his sights on a scooter that could be worth 3,000 dollars, and Lesa spots a snake-skin ensemble.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers bid for some scruffy looking lockers, but appearances prove deceptive as the most unattractive units turn out to contain the most valuable contents.

programme.title: Mega Disasters
programme.desc: The devastation caused by a Tsunami, which is triggered primarily by earthquakes. Its giant waves can strike with unrivalled force and ferocity.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Zachary Quinto tackles the ultimate existential question as he explores what happens when people die and whether or not there is life after death.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Theorists offer compelling evidence suggesting that the ancient monolith thought to depict Egyptian pharaoh Khafra once represented an alien being.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les confronts Seth after finding out that he was at Bill's pawn shop. He asks some blunt questions about why he would betray the family by visiting a rival store.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: On the last day of the Dream Cruise, Les buys what is claimed to be the world's largest fishing lure - reportedly an art piece saluting Michigan - for $3,000

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley smells cannabis smoke in the warehouse and tries to find the culprit, while Les puts out a cash reward for information.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les has the opportunity to get his hands on truck loads of brand new goods that could change the store for ever.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys get involved in a dispute with a former employee over a 1968 Corvette Stingray, before Allen Haff tests his ninja skills with an antique weapon.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones are out-contested by a glamorous duo, but a rash bid on some apparent trash leads to an unexpected outcome. Meanwhile, a punt on an ancient artifact is considered.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: An Oregon man shoots some incredible Bigfoot footage, UFOs gather over Texas and an active poltergeist appears in Wales.

programme.title: The Lowe Files
programme.desc: Matthew, and John Owen join father Rob Lowe as he takes his pursuit of Bigfoot to the Midwest, where locals refer to the mythical creature by another name - the Wood Ape.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers return to Montebello, where Darrell made the most profitable purchase in the show's history.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi attends an auction without Jarrod, who has no idea what she intends to spend their money on. Darrell finds a kit that could brew him a nice profit.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: Dave admits his addiction to 'property porn', worries about the demise of surprise and invites the audience to conduct a live experiment with more than 1,000 eggs.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Warwick Davis, Paul Hollywood, Jason Manford and Joan Bakewell join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Richard Osman, Lolly Adefope and Lee Mack join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig to contemplate the theme 'naked truth' in this extended episode. As usual, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, in which the questions are so difficult points are awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Comedians Hugh Dennis, Omid Djalili and Roisin Conaty and anatomist, author and broadcaster Alice Roberts join team captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe to answer questions about famous people who share a name, with the winners earning the right to pick the greatest bearer of the moniker. Sue Perkins hosts.

programme.title: Comedians Giving Lectures
programme.desc: Stand-up comedians are given the titles of real lectures and invited to give their own version. Presented by Sara Pascoe. With Nish Kumar, Natasia Demetriou and Tom Allen.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Gendle and Tim are dropped into a downhill bike park and create a human marble run using motorbikes and riders wearing zorbs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.sub-title: If You Talk Nice To Me
programme.desc: Mike is on a quest to buy a rare cycle car he has coveted for more than two years, but it is going to take a lot of luck and charm to seal the deal.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders are in Alton, Hampshire, where Linda is concerned that the other bidders are taking advantage of her superior knowledge and her looks. Meanwhile, Boudicca and Heavy D form more than just a business partnership, and Barry impresses with his dainty footwork.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: As well as Heavy D, Nat has to deal with some voodoo magic, which all proves too much for her. Thankfully auctioneer Sean Kelly is on hand with an emergency vehicle.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys discover a stash of unusual micro-cars. Plus, when Frank meets a fellow Frank, it is a match made in picking heaven.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys take to the track for a grudge match drag race, with Mike and Frank both determined to prove they have the fastest ride.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: More thrills, spills, customer carts and crashes in this extreme downhill battle at the Eduardo VII Park in Lisbon.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are each challenged to find a classic car at auction for Â£3,000. Exploring whether they are more fun to drive than modern alternatives, the trio then take the vehicles to Majorca to compete in a rally. Jeremy also test-drives the BMW Z4 and Nissan 370Z, and AC/DC frontman Brian Johnson is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Ultimate Movers
programme.desc: Haulier Chris Bugler must transport the largest cargo of his life from Dorset to Poole Port, while at Santa Pod, the fastest movers in Europe compete on the drag racing track.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Head of Fleet Services John Heussi and his team redesign the vehicles that transport the dog units, turning a humble Ford Mondeo into a Dog Van.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May are challenged to create a TV advert for Volkswagen, but soon fall out as James concentrates on detailed information on fuel economy and Jeremy wants something more exciting. Richard Hammond explores an alternative to Germanic sports saloons and tests the Vauxhall VXR8 Bathurst, and former US chat show host Jay Leno is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: In a first for the show, James May shocks the rest of the team when he puts his foot firmly on the accelerator of a Bugatti Veyron. Meanwhile, a case of bad driving and appalling trousers results in all three presenters getting thrown off a golf course. Actor Hugh Grant is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis, Joe Lycett, Lolly Adefope, Mel Giedroyc and Noel Fielding fell rubber ducks and destroy a cake to impress the very demanding Greg Davies.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Stand-up star David O'Doherty, Pointless co-host Richard Osman, comedienne Susan Calman and weather presenter Carol Kirkwood join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Stand-ups Sarah Millican and Jon Richardson, actor David Harewood and comic Bob Mortimer join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Absolutely Fabulous creator Jennifer Saunders, comedian Romesh Ranganathan, W1A star Jessica Hynes and historian Suzannah Lipscomb join team captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe to answer questions about famous people who share a name, with the winners earning the right to pick the greatest bearer of the moniker. Sue Perkins hosts.

programme.title: Comedy Against Living Miserably
programme.desc: Stand-up comedy special, hosted and headlined by Nish Kumar, with support from Suzi Ruffell, Darren Harriot and Seann Walsh..

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies hosts more surreal celebrity challenges, as Lolly Adefope tries long distance painting, and Hugh Dennis is befuddled by an egg.

programme.title: Dara O Briain's Go 8 Bit
programme.desc: Kevin Bridges and Natasia Demetriou play a series of video games, including Joust and Plants vs Zombies: Garden Warfare 2.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch desperately wants to get out of the tedious task of making fishing nets, and hatches a crafty scheme to get himself assigned to the library. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher takes on the role of agony aunt and ends up writing letters home for his fellow inmates - but he soon discovers domestic problems of his own when his daughter brings bad news on visiting day. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Patricia Brake.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The battle for North Africa, which involved three years of fighting between Rommel's Afrika Korps and Montgomery's Desert Rats and culminated in the Allied victory at El Alamein. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on an expedition along Dorset's Jurassic coast to explore the county's hidden Second World War story. Starting beside the defences on Chesil Beach, he heads east to finish in Swanage and Studland Bay. On his five-day walk he encounters stunning scenery and uncovers wartime acts of ingenuity and bravery. He also discovers the crucial part a swannery played in developing a secret weapon and reveals the role of Dorset in protecting Britain from invasion during the conflict.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson goes on a four-day trek through the Kintail region of the north-western Highlands, examining the story of the Jacobite uprisings of the early 1700s along the way. He starts by visiting Iron Age dwellings in Shiel Bridge, and heads to the rebuilt castle on Eilean Donan, the original of which was destroyed after invading Spanish troops landed there and were attacked by British warships. Tony ends in Glen Shiel, the site of a climactic battle in 1719 where royalist troops defeated the rebels.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on a 45-mile walk across Wiltshire, from Avebury to Stonehenge, telling the story of the remarkable development that occurred in the latter days of the Neolithic era. His route over chalk downlands and Salisbury Plain takes him through one of the greatest concentrations of prehistoric sites in Europe.

programme.title: Royal Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: The Earl of Erroll - Death in the Valley
programme.desc: Crimes involving members of royal families from around the globe, beginning with an earl shot dead in a hedonistic hideaway for colonial aristocrats in Kenya.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The largest evacuation of the Second World War, which saw two million civilians and soldiers removed in an extraordinary German operation that lasted for four months.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The battle for North Africa, which involved three years of fighting between Rommel's Afrika Korps and Montgomery's Desert Rats and culminated in the Allied victory at El Alamein. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A fuel plant in Poland built to make Nazi Germany self-sufficient by using the latest technology of the time to turn coal into oil.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an exploration of Earth's vast seas, which cover 70 per cent of the planet's surface. In the first episode, millions of squid appear off the coast of California, gannets, whale sharks and dolphins hunt migrating sardines in the Indian Ocean, and thousands of turtles make the annual pilgrimage to lay their eggs in Costa Rica.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter continues his examination of how the car became an everyday part of people's lives, exploring the weird world of small vehicles. He discovers how austerity and fears of congestion led to European disasters in the shape of Britain's infamous three-wheelers, French death traps and German absurdities, and also takes to the battlefield to settle one of the greatest rivalries in car history.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the life and work of people in the polar regions, including the residents of Norilsk in Siberia, the coldest city on Earth. He also discovers how the Danish armed forces maintain their country's claim to Greenland's natural resources by mounting a 2,000-mile dog sled patrol during the winter, and finds out how a research base at the South Pole is able to cope with being cut off from the outside world for six months at a time.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Camera crews journey to the deepest parts of the world's oceans to explore the lives of their inhabitants, including fearsome predators with huge teeth, strange jellyfish and deep-sea sharks that lurk among the gigantic submerged mountains and volcanos. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Three Gorges Dam, built across China's Yangtze river, which is the largest and heaviest concrete structure ever built, housing the world's largest power station.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: A Scottish soldier who walked 200 miles through the Libyan desert without water or supplies recalls Ronald Moore, the leader of his party.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How the myth of German invincibility was finally debunked by their defeat at the Battle of Stalingrad. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A towering structure with an explosive past, a deserted cityscape, a mysterious top-secret facility and a vast Nazi construction.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Stratolaunch is designed to lift rockets, spacecraft and experimental high-speed hypersonic planes into the stratosphere, then release them for their onward journey into space.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates face a day of hard labour digging drains on a lonely stretch of moorland. However, Fletcher soon finds a way of turning the situation to his advantage. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch desperately wants to get out of the tedious task of making fishing nets, and hatches a crafty scheme to get himself assigned to the library. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher takes on the role of agony aunt and ends up writing letters home for his fellow inmates - but he soon discovers domestic problems of his own when his daughter brings bad news on visiting day. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Patricia Brake.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Edmund receives a visit from the bloodthirsty Bishop of Bath and Wells, who threatens to do him a mischief with a red-hot poker over the matter of an unpaid loan. As he attempts to raise the Â£1,000 he needs, he finds himself being constantly summoned to the court by the Queen. Comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson and Miranda Richardson.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Lord Melchett challenges Edmund to a drinking contest that he cannot get out of - but his puritanical uncle and aunt Lord and Lady Whiteadder are visiting on the same night, leaving him trying to be in two places at once. Comedy, guest starring Miriam Margolyes, with Rowan Atkinson and Stephen Fry.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. After a naked woman is found fleeing a car accident, she is taken to hospital and tests reveal her DNA is linked to a double murder in 1960s Soho. Boyd discovers the victim, successful entrepreneur Elizabeth Andrews, has suffered a horrific attack at the hands of her abductors and he is led to her home, where a man presumed to be her husband is found hanged in the hallway. With a new murder as well as the cold case to solve, the team tries to connect the crimes, but a greater danger awaits Elizabeth in hospital. Drama, starring Trevor Eve and his real-life wife Sharon Maughan.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: A Small Price to Pay - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of three. Gina returns to her job immediately after receiving treatment for her cancer. Clearly unfit for work but too stubborn to admit it, she relies on June to oversee the relief. Gary is shot during a raid on a gang suspected of handling stolen goods, while Phil bristles with righteous indignation at the discovery that Kate has been mugged at knifepoint and vows to catch the thug responsible. As for Adam, he hits another snag as he tries to get his road safety initiative up and running, and again asks Isaac Collins to help - unaware his old friend's shady past is about to catch up with him.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The Blue Watch boys tackle two different, but equally dangerous and challenging blazes, one at a car-breaker's yard, the other in a Chinese restaurant.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Headland Garden in Polruan, Cornwall - one of the participants opening its havens to the public in the National Gardens Scheme - where plants face the harsh conditions of salt air and high winds.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah and George begin a secret affair and meet at the cottage. However, Anna hopes that if she can push her father towards Sarah that he will be more open to learning about her relationship with Gino, but she is frustrated over the arrival of her aunt Regina. Meanwhile, James struggles with his emotions. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: George is asked to host a Japanese trade delegation on the eve of Remembrance Day. Knowing how the community will react, he asks Jack to come to the reception in the hope that the approval of a former Japanese prisoner of war might help deal with any ill feeling. At the event Regina is openly hostile toward Sarah, which she attributes to anti-Semitism. Anna's prolonged absence from Ash Park has Gino fearing that their relationship is over, but he is unaware that she is with Caroline awaiting the results of a pregnancy test. Meanwhile, James and Olivia continue to grow closer. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: A Small Price to Pay - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of three. Gina returns to her job immediately after receiving treatment for her cancer. Clearly unfit for work but too stubborn to admit it, she relies on June to oversee the relief. Gary is shot during a raid on a gang suspected of handling stolen goods, while Phil bristles with righteous indignation at the discovery that Kate has been mugged at knifepoint and vows to catch the thug responsible. As for Adam, he hits another snag as he tries to get his road safety initiative up and running, and again asks Isaac Collins to help - unaware his old friend's shady past is about to catch up with him.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: The tension between Ric and Nick reaches crisis point during a bowel transplant operation, and Diane is forced to pick sides. Joseph treats a Bosnian woman who does not speak English, and is unaware of the full extent of her condition - but his decision to tell her the truth has disastrous consequences. After dealing with a medical emergency in the lab, Matt realises he misses treating patients.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: The arrival of arrogant new registrar Patrick Spiller makes a bad impression among staff, particularly Holly, who has crossed his path before. Adam receives a nasty reminder of Sam's accident, and the parachute jump proves eventful for a nervous Max. Claire Goose and Robert Gwilym star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: A Small Price to Pay - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of three. Jack embarks on a relentless search for the gunman who shot Gary - and soon realises the finger of suspicion is pointing firmly at Adam's friend Isaac Collins. Smithy and Jonathan call at Gina's house to see why she hasn't turned up for work, and discover her unconscious on the bathroom floor. Away from the line of duty, Tony feels dejected at not having a date for Honey's birthday party and decides to hire an escort for the evening - little anticipating the surprise awaiting him.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Richard gets an unwelcome surprise from Cindy and Ian. Dot is in a happy mood as she looks forward to a special visitor. Nigel receives some bad news from Debbie via Clare.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Beth breaks Nigels weak and feeble heart and Michelle entrusts Shelly with Vicky, only to find out that shes exposed her daughter to a drug fuelled pot session.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Bluewatch are called to extinguish a fire at a school and find two missing boys. Meanwhile, Adriane falls down a flight of stairs during an argument with Nick.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Archie has to choose between giving his business partnership with Paul one last chance or going mountaineering in Nepal with his sister Lizzie to honour their father's memory. Meanwhile, Molly is angry that Andrew has ignored her since returning from their romantic weekend, but Golly gains the courage to admit his hidden feelings to her. Alastair Mackenzie and Susan Hampshire star.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Tom Beresford returns to Skelthwaite 20 years after a bitter family row, lured by the offer of a managerial position at Goddard's, and it's not long before he and his good-looking son are setting tongues wagging. Karen breaks all the rules to help two families come to terms with the consequences of a transplant operation, but her ill-advised actions backfire. Vic decides the time has come for a younger man to captain the Scorpions and an emotional Simon proposes to Anna. Drama, starring Tony Haygarth, Lesley Dunlop and Leslie Ash.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Connie and Oswald join the holiday to see Billy and Aveline, and Joey's protest about the game shooting on the estate wins him an admirer.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Peggy becomes a Yellowcoat, but her happiness is spoilt when Alec Foster arrives with bad news. Last-ever episode of the hit comedy, starring Su Pollard and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean calls on Alistair's help to do a spot of match-making and Lionel finds himself in the middle of a muddle. Comedy, with Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The mischievous trio come to the aid of an old friend with an unusual medical problem, while Ivy becomes increasingly irate that no one will fix the cafe roof.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: Bacchus and Gently investigate a consignment of stolen passports, but the case takes an unexpected turn when a woman linked to the crime is found dead on the seashore with her mixed-race baby lying next to her. As the duo follow a lead on the murder victim's ex-boyfriend, they encounter racial prejudice and are drawn into an underground world of gang wars within the Arab community. Primeval's Andrew-Lee Potts guest stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The ex-coppers find themselves under the microscope when a psychologist arrives to conduct a study into older men in the workplace - but she soon reveals a more personal reason for her visit. It turns out that five years ago her brother, a cycle courier, was the victim of a hit-and-run that left him unable to recall anything prior to the incident. Now he says he was targeted for the parcel he was carrying, which was stolen at the scene - or so he believes. Sally Phillips guest stars.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The attempted suicide of a rape victim 12 years after her assault prompts Boyd to reopen the case, despite there being no new evidence. Their boss's illegal methods provide Grace, Spencer and the team with a suspect - but he quickly becomes aware the detectives are on his trail. Drama, starring Trevor Eve, with Ian Mercer, Michelle Dockery and Rory Kinnear.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: The conclusion of Julian Fellowes' drama about secrets and lies in uptight 19th-century London society. James travels to Manchester to investigate the allegations made against Charles, but soon realises there are greater threats at play. Lady Templemore employs Reggie to make Lady Maria change her mind, but her daughter will not give in so easily. Susan is in danger of losing of losing everything after he secret is revealed, but as ever she used her cunning to twist the situation to her own and others' benefit, while Charles is puzzled to receive a mysterious olive branch. Keen to end the feuding, he seeks out the offer of reconciliation - unaware he is being lured into danger.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Barging Round Britain with John Sergeant
programme.desc: The broadcaster takes in the delights of the Lancaster Canal, setting out from Tewitfield. As he meanders down the waterway, John cannot resist visiting Carnforth railway station, where he re-enacts his favourite scene from the classic film Brief Encounter, some of which was filmed there. After Carnforth, the canal crosses the River Lune on its way to Lancaster, where the veteran journalist marvels at the engineering of the Lune Aqueduct. Later, he heads south to Garstang, famous for its cheeses, and finally on towards Preston.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Ruth Langsford, Denise Welch, Janet Street-Porter, and Brenda Edwards are on the Loose Women panel, discussing the day's most topical issues, from current affairs to celebrity gossip and the latest showbiz news. Special guests Karren Brady and Craig Revel Horwood join the panel to talk about what they've been getting up to recently.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: The chef visits Northumberland, where he is joined by Michelin-starred chef Kenny Atkinson. The pair learn how Mead is made on Holy Island, and James cooks up a Singapore-inspired crab and lobster dish on a stunning beach, before they both enjoy a Puffin cruise to Cockett Island.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of family members answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as another four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser. Answering general knowledge questions, they each add as much money as they dare to the jackpot - but anyone caught by the Chaser is out for good, leaving fewer players to team up and play in the final chase.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Charity hopes to claw her relationship with Vanessa back from the brink, but Vanessa remains angered by her behaviour the day before and plans a birthday night out for Rhona as she tries to escape the reality of her condition. Dawn is crestfallen to see how well the foster parents seem to get on with Lucas and is no longer sure having custody is the best thing for them, while Moira wonders what's going on with Cain.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gary intervenes in Amy and Kelly's fight and Asha finally realises who she can trust, while Ken tells Claudia that Stillwaters will never be his home and Johnny feels uneasy leaving Scott at the Rovers.

programme.title: Kate & Koji
programme.desc: Not for the first time, Kate is being sued, but this time by Councillor Bone. Koji discovers he is under investigation for working illegally, and things do not improve when he tells Kate what he really thinks about her grandson. Comedy, starring Brenda Blethyn and Jimmy Akingbola.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul meets a hyperactive staffie called Cookie, who training staff believe could make an excellent working dog, but this is not usual for staffies, so finding someone to take him on may be difficult. Paul also meets a two-year-old Dogue de Bordeaux in need of some love after being found abandoned in a park, and nine-month-old teacup poodle Charlie is having trouble running with her broken leg. Head vet Shaun explains that Charlie has three breaks on one leg, and the best thing for her is going to be to remove it.

programme.title: Our Queen at War
programme.desc: How the life of the young Princess Elizabeth was shaped by the events of the Second World War, and the extraordinary experiences she went through during her teenage years. The film draws on archive material and interviews with people who shared her experiences, and royal experts explore how she was transformed from a shy princess into Queen Elizabeth II and Britain's longest reigning monarch.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five members of a family from Lancashire answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Looking after sharks in one of the world's largest aquariums, how precious stones are grown, and the manufacturing processes involved in creating Bentley cars.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer logs on to an online auction searching for a cheap Suzuki in need of repair. He soon finds an SJ410 and hands the vehicle over to mechanic Edd China for restoration.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. The work on the Suzuki continues as Edd China gives it a new interior, paint job and roll cage, aiming to make a tidy profit.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce hears about some Second World War British RAF gear from the Battle of Arnhem for sale, which is of big interest to ex-paratroopers like him and Freddie.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part one of two. Paul Jr is having trouble getting both the Geico and Anti-Venom bikes ready in time for the Sturgis rally.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Following the work of Nick Popovich, as he uses spotters and pilots to help locate multimillion-dollar aircraft for repossession.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe examines the dung of racehorses at the Kentucky Equine Research Facility, and learns why the process can provide important information about their performance.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: External Hard Drives/Frozen Shrimp/Thai Rice Boxes/Paper Towels
programme.desc: More everyday items are put under the microscope as the production processes of external hard drives, frozen shrimp, Thai rice boxes and paper towels are explained.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: A look at how tea, roof finials, artificial flowers and alloy wheels are either made or processed.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how the world's most expensive tea is harvested and treated. Plus, how the Siekierki power plant of Warsaw, Poland, manages to heat half the city's homes.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.sub-title: Morris Minor Traveller and Maserati Ghibli
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Paul Cowland find a Morris Traveller at the largest private car collection in the UK. Later, in Surrey, the salvage aficionados spot a rare but affordable Maserati.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The fleet is plunged into crisis, with skipper Phil fighting for his life while his sons feud, and Captain Sig's brother contemplates quitting.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: After a month on the ice, the miners reach the last day of the season, and make use of their remaining time by proving the risks they faced were worth the cost.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for a V8-powered Land Rover Defender for less than Â£5,000, that modifications expert Edd China can turn into a modern urban vehicle.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for a Volvo P1800 - but owing to a lack of available specimens, has trouble finding one that fits into his price range.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini travels to Maine to look at a 1931 Packard, while the shop restores a 1967 Corvette.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne has got his eye on an original 1904 Ford. However, when the bidding forces him to put down his paddle, he's in for a surprise of a lifetime.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini travels to California to look at a 1967 Ferrari 275 GTB/4 bought by actor Steve McQueen in 1967, which has a multi-million dollar value.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini is commissioned to sell a 1966 Ferrari 365P Tre Posti, which is one of only two ever to be created.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard and Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland head to the Midlands to look at a Swedish classic - the Volvo Amazon. When Paul falls for an early Toyota MR2, he seeks a way to convince Drew it will turn a profit.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Bike guru Henry Cole and ace-mechanic Sam Lovegrove arrive in Cornwall, looking for something to buy, restore and sell on for a handsome profit. At a windswept hilltop farm they find cars, tractors and a very rare German scooter.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.sub-title: Hot Rods, Trucks and Miniture Bikes
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove are in the New Forest, looking for things to buy, restore and sell for profit, where they meet Stumpie, an Americana fanatic whose sheds are full of rare bicycles, classic sportsters and pimped-up saloon cars.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Compton dives into the murky secrets of Second World War spies. In Italy, he unearths an iconic code-breaking machine. In the UK the lads revive two rocket launchers.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard seeks standout items to lure more customers to his shop. In Derbyshire, he finds a Regency picture frame, and buys a pair of Danish rattan chairs in Harrogate.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Cabinet maker Alex repairs a battered chest that once belonged to a secretive Masonic lodge. Blacksmith Nev uses his skills to restore some historic street lamps.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer logs on to an online auction searching for a cheap Suzuki in need of repair. He soon finds an SJ410 and hands the vehicle over to mechanic Edd China for restoration.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. The work on the Suzuki continues as Edd China gives it a new interior, paint job and roll cage, aiming to make a tidy profit.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Tee John take a road trip in Hungary. In Budapest, they visit one of the country's biggest antique markets. Later, they unearth treasures in a former communist factory.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits Bamburgh Castle on the Northumberland coast, where he uncovers interesting artefacts.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Paul Cowland head to Kent to look at a glamorous Sunbeam Alpine roadster. With the classic car in demand, Paul is sure it's a smart buy, but Drew needs some convincing.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Deep in the heart of Texas, Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz play a couple of hands of Texas Pick'em with some savvy collectors. They also visit a family whose members have several cars from the late 1920s and early 1930s.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The technology that helps restore old films, how oil is gathered from forest mud, and the safety processes used in the shipping industry.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The technology used to make batteries from brine, turn wood into paper and build the world's most exclusive luxury car.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: The murder of John Proctor, by his neice Susan Warne. When the seemingly healthy 80-year-old was found dead at home, police were stumped. But, Warne was hiding a dark secret that lead to his death.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: How a love triangle between two sisters and one of their husbands led to a shocking murder when Sabah Khan stabbed sibling Saima Khan in Luton in 2006. Here, detectives review the case that proved love can ruin any family bond.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: The crimes of Hannegret Donnelly, who battered husband Christopher to death with 78 visible injuries in Aylesbury, Buckinghamshire. In court, it transpired she had been abusing him at home for years.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: A classic love triangle that lasted 16 years led to a shocking murder by Lakhvir Singh in 2009. Her method of killing gave her the nickname 'The Curry Killer'.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The Bureau's hunt for a gang of serial killers who targeted police in Washington DC, claiming several victims before months of painstaking nationwide surveillance finally paid off.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigator Stephen Goldman rescues a dog that has become trapped in a fence and is so undernourished it can barely walk.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A Shar Pei dog's excessive folds of skin threaten to damage its eyesight, so Dr Chris Brown performs a nip-tuck operation.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A change of venue leaves Amy wanting to replace her wedding dress, while Tara seeks an outfit that accentuates her figure and Lisa has her eye on a $4,000 gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride fights with her groom's sister over the choice of dress, and another upsets her bridesmaids with her lack of style.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride fights with her mother who wants the bridesmaids to look like pink ballerinas, while a woman tries to avoid a war by letting her party pick their own dresses.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A customer tries to bond with her estranged half-sister while shopping for a dress, and a bride looks for the perfect gown to impress her fiance.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A visitor to the shop is on the verge of a panic attack, and a bride needs to find a dress that all her university friends can agree on.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A customer wants to look like Cinderella and get married at Disneyland, and a bride buys a dress, but then worries she has made the wrong choice.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: Plus-size opera singer Amanda comes to the store to find a diva dress, while bride Karalee realises that she is not comfortable with the dress she has bought.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown travels to the Barossa Valley in South Australia to help an orphan lamb. Plus, Tim Faulkner learns about a breeding programme for the Tasmanian Devil.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown treats a baby cheetah, a shaking cavoodle and a pig.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How clues found in common substances can help investigators solve homicide cases.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The challenges faced by investigators trying to catch the most elusive of murderers - those who choose their victims at random.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A search for a missing man uncovers a cold blooded murder. Plus, a couple uncover a dark secret when they find a shallow grave under their new house.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Scientists use forensic evidence to try to uncover the identity of the killer of a young mother, who was stabbed in her kitchen, and an elderly couple who were shot dead.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Following the fortunes of talented musician and singer Brandon, whose addiction to food has left him incapacitated. He now risks losing his girlfriend and his career dreams.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Suffering from flesh-eating bacteria and weighing almost 800lbs, Charity relies on her family for support. When bad news threatens her weight loss, can she carry on?.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three would-be dealers have 800 euros to spend at a Carpentras market in the south of France, do up the items in the UK, and then hope to sell everything in Winchester.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: The owner of London Road Pawnbrokers in Sheffield has to deal with a bus-load of antiques and a watch once owned by Saddam Hussein. Meanwhile, 200 miles away at Pickwicks in London, Nathan and Debbs value an impressive collection of jewels and watches, a set of antique coins and a pair of luxury designer handbags.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Lindsey seemed to have it all - but her food addiction threatens to ruin everything. As she starts her weight loss journey, is her husband supportive?.

programme.title: My Feet Are Killing Me
programme.sub-title: Somewhere in There Is a Foot
programme.desc: A woman with a life-threatening scar on her foot turns to Dr Schaeffer for help. Then, a man comes in with a terrible case of foot fungus.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: The story of Mahesh who weighs 150kg due to a syndrome that encourages constant eating. Plus, a development in the womb left a boy with no eyes.

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: Three separate cases in which women went missing from the Kansas City area after setting out to meet a man they had got to know online. Police believed the same fate had befallen them at the hands of the same man, so they trailed their suspect.
